name: Lolium temulentum

Head: Vertigo; must close eyes
Noises in ears
Anxious and depressed, confused
Head heavy
Stomach: Pain in pit of stomach and abdomen
Extremities: Violent pain in calves, as if bound with cords
Spasmodic motion of arms and legs
Cannot write; cannot hold a glass of water
In trembling of hands and legsgait unsteady

details: Has been made use of in cephalgia, sciatica, paralysis. Prostration and restlessness.
